704015f-a.title: Brooklyn: Devoe Street - Lorimer Street
704015f-a.text:
36-42 Devoe Street, south side, Just west of Lorimer Street,
showing the J . A. Rhodes' saw factory. It was built on 1250.
This is the rear of the factory. Although Tr. Armbruster states
that the factory was located on Ainslie Street near Yenth Street,
the present (1941) Keap Street, the writer of these lines was
unable to locate any saw factory at that location from 1874
to the present. The only saw factory, or file factory (the
two are used interchangeably in the old Brooklyn buslness
directories), in this area appears in Hromleys 1880 map on
the south side of Devoe Street (which is oue block Iorth of
Ainslie Street), Just west of Lorimer -treet. It is very
likely that this is the saw factory Mr. Armbruster has in mind.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  about 1890
MAY BE REPRODUCED
